recipes.title: Orange Chilli Spaghetti
recipes.description: This might seem like a weird combination but it‚Äôs more subtle than you would expect. You could even eat the spaghetti just like that without any vegetables.
recipes.rewardText: With this adventurous combination you found a way to create taste without using beef.

cookSteps.title: Spread cauliflower and cherry tomatoes on a baking sheet and crumble feta on top, season with salt and pepper
Cook the spaghetti
cookSteps.detail: Add a little pinch of salt and use enough water

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion
cookSteps.detail: Medium heat

cookSteps.title: Add garlic, chilli, cumin and paprika powder
cookSteps.detail: Toast but don't let it burn

cookSteps.title: Add orange juice
cookSteps.detail: Bring to boil and simmer, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.credits: Thanks to Cristina for this recipe

recipes.title: Aubergine Tomato Curry
recipes.description: A curry inspired by a Pakistani recipe. The aubergine is extra delicious if you first brown it on high heat. The original recipe is a dry curry without coconut milk, which also works, just add some water. You could replace the rice with quinoa.
recipes.rewardText: Curries are one of the easiest ways to leave out meat.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and aubergine
cookSteps.detail: high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat and add garlic and ginger
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, until aubergine is golden brown

cookSteps.title: Add curry powder and chilli powder
Add tomatoes
cookSteps.detail: bring to boil and simmer, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

cookSteps.title: Add coconut milk and chickpeas
cookSteps.detail: simmer

recipes.title: Green Lemon Spaghetti
recipes.description: A straightforward and fresh spaghetti. You could even leave away the cream to make it lighter.
recipes.rewardText: Popeye would be proud of your spinach power.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions
cookSteps.detail: medium heat

cookSteps.title: Add zucchini and garlic
cookSteps.detail: season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add spinach, cream, lemon zest and pesto and lemon juice to personal taste
cookSteps.detail: stir and bring to boil/simmer

cookSteps.title: Add peas
cookSteps.detail: taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: African Peanut Soup
recipes.description: Tomato paste with chilli and peanut butter is a West African sauce for sweet potatoes, rice, meat or veggies in countries like Benin. You could also puree the sweet potatoes instead of leaving them in blocks.
recipes.rewardText: If you used beef bouillon, you created beef flavour without beef emissions.
prepSteps: Peel and cut sweet potatoes into blocks

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and sweet potato
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add peanut butter and bouillon
cookSteps.detail: Simmer with lid on, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

cookSteps.title: Add spinach
cookSteps.detail: Simmer

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Roast
recipes.description: This is a variation on the typical Dutch meal of having potatoes, veggies and meat. A bit of soy sauce gives the extra umami to the creamy spinach.
recipes.rewardText: You made a potato dish without meat, great job!
prepSteps: Pre-heat oven to 200¬∞C (if you can, use fan oven at 175¬∞C)
Peel and cut sweet potatoes into blocks of ca. 2 cm

cookSteps.title: Spread sweet potatoes and cauliflower on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil, paprika powder, salt and pepper
cookSteps.detail: ~20 min at 200¬∞C (or 175¬∞C for fan)

cookSteps.title: In the meantime, saut√© onion and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: high heat

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat and add soy sauce
cookSteps.detail: lower heat to medium and cook until mushrooms have shrunk

cookSteps.title: Add spinach, vinegar, walnuts and (soy) cream
cookSteps.detail: cook until you have a thick spinach sauce, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Peanut Fruit Rice
recipes.description: This recipe is orginally from Rwanda. There is no sauce, but because the rice is cooked in coconut milk it still is a creamy dish.
recipes.rewardText: Peanuts are actually legumes, not nuts. And they pack loads of protein.
prepSteps: Halve carrots and cut into slices
Halve the green beans and take off top

cookSteps.title: Cook rice in coconut milk and stock
cookSteps.detail: Mix the coconut milk and stock so you have 1,5 times the amount of rice. Bring to boil with the rice, then reduce heat to low and put on a lid. Taste regularly and add more water, salt and pepper if necessary.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and carrots
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Lower heat and add garlic, apple, chilli and curry
cookSteps.detail: stir occasionally and don't let it burn

cookSteps.title: Add 2-3 TBL sp of water and the peanuts and raisins

recipes.title: Oat Risotto with Prunes
recipes.description: This risotto recipe uses oats instead of rice! Because of the nutty flavour of the oats it doesn't need butter or cheese. The original recipe from Wolfgang Puck mixes in a pea puree at the end to make it creamier (just put some peas in a blender). Using the prunes, walnuts, leek and mushrooms as topping also works with regular risotto.
recipes.rewardText: Wow look at you, you've made super low impact risotto.
prepSteps: Set the table (it's best to serve risotto immediately)

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat (in oil) until soft but not coloured

cookSteps.title: Boil water and mix stock
cookSteps.detail: keep it at a low boil

cookSteps.title: Add oats and garlic to the onion
cookSteps.detail: stir so the oats are heated but don't let them brown, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add white wine
cookSteps.detail: it should sizzle, cook until you don't see any liquid from the wine

cookSteps.title: Start adding hot stock, one bit at a time
cookSteps.detail:
stir until nearly all has been absorbed - the oats should always be soft rather than dry. Repeat this process until the oats are soft but still have a little bite (so it's important to taste it regularly). Add salt and pepper if needed. 
Keep stirring often and adjust heat if it's too hot, you have to avoid burning the oats.

cookSteps.title: In the meantime, saut√© mushroom in a new pan
cookSteps.detail: start with high heat and then lower the heat until all moisture is gone, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add leek, walnuts and prunes to the mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: cook until the leek is soft

cookSteps.title: Serve the risotto with the mushrooms, leek and walnuts on top and add lemon juice to taste
cookSteps.detail: A perfect risotto is creamy and much more fluid than rice, that's why risotto is served on a deep plate. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Roast Potatoes with Mustard
recipes.description: Roasted parsnips and carrots are a dream team. Adding the mustard gravy is a simple way to turn the veggies into a very comforting meal. If you don't like mustard you can leave away the whole sauce and serve with mayonnaise.
recipes.rewardText: Wow look at you, you've enjoyed an amazing combination of veggies.
prepSteps: Cut 1 onion into rings and dice the other
Cut carrots and parsnips into long slices

cookSteps.title: Halve the baby potatoes and cook shortly
Spread potatoes, broccoli, parsnips, carrots and onion rings on a baking sheet and drizzle with some olive oil, season with salt and pepper
Add paprika powder, cumin, mustard and garlic
Add (soy)cream and sun-dried tomatoes
cookSteps.detail: taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Creamy Mushroom Pasta
recipes.description: The mushrooms get some extra umami with the soy sauce and fresh parsley finishes this creamy dish. If you want a lot of sauce you should add a bit more cream.
recipes.rewardText: Wow look at you, you've created an umami flavour without meat!
prepSteps: Cut bell peppers into thin slices
Take off top from beans and halve them

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: high heat

cookSteps.title: Cook pasta and green beans
cookSteps.detail: Add the beans about 2 minutes later. The beans need ~10 minutes so adjust based on the cooking time of pasta accordingly

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat and add garlic and soy sauce to the onion and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, simmer until most of the moisture from the mushrooms is gone

cookSteps.title: Add (soy) cream, oregano and olives
cookSteps.detail: season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add the pasta and green beans and mix well

recipes.title: Chilli spaghetti
recipes.description: Italian dishes are usually not something we eat spicy, but including some chillies creates a delightful surprise.
recipes.rewardText: But be aware: shouldn't we have called this garlic spaghetti?
prepSteps: Cut away the seeds of the chilli peppers and chop finely
Cut bell pepper into short strips

cookSteps.title: Saut√© garlic and chilli
cookSteps.detail: low/medium heat in plenty of oil

cookSteps.title: Cook pasta
cookSteps.detail: save 100 ml of the water when the pasta is done

cookSteps.title: Add tomatoes and bell peppers
cookSteps.detail: cook until soft, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add ca. 100 ml pasta water, sugar and the lentils
cookSteps.detail: simmer, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Shepherd‚Äôs Pie
recipes.description: I would say this version of the traditional English recipe lives up to the original. The bacon gives a lot of flavour and the (soy) cream creates smooth potato mash. I like the texture of carrots and celery, but if you prefer them very soft then cook them before adding to the sauce.
recipes.rewardText: Wow look at you, with minimal meat you've created maximal taste!
prepSteps: Cut carrots into slices or cubes

cookSteps.title: Cook potatoes
cookSteps.detail: they're ready when you can easily pierce them. Drain them and save around 100 ml of the water.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and bacon pieces
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat until bacon is crispy

cookSteps.title: Add tomato paste, cumin, coriander and paprika powder
Add lentils, lemon juice and add ca. 100 ml of the potato water
cookSteps.detail: season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add the (soy) cream and mash the potatoes
Pour the sauce into an oven dish. Spread the potato mash on top. Place the cherry tomatoes on top and sprinkle with some bread crumbs

recipes.title: Oven Polenta
recipes.description: Polenta is a powder made from corn that makes a deliciously smooth meal together with some cheese and margarine. It‚Äôs an Italian dish so you can find it in the pasta section.
recipes.rewardText: Wow look at you, you've made super low impact risotto.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, until mushrooms shrink and moisture is gone

cookSteps.title: Prepare vegetable bouillon
cookSteps.detail: (1,1 l for 250 gr polenta). Taste and add more stock powder if necessary.

cookSteps.title: Add zucchini, tomatoes, oregano and balsamic vinegar
cookSteps.detail: let everything simmer until warm, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat of the veggie stock and slowly stir in the polenta
cookSteps.detail: make sure it doesn't burn

cookSteps.title: Add the margarine and half of the cheese
cookSteps.detail: stir well

cookSteps.title: Spread the polenta into an oven dish. Add the vegetables on top and sprinkle with the rest of cheese

recipes.title: Spinach pesto
recipes.description: I discovered this recipe by accident, and it was part of the inspiration for this book. The combination of tomatoes and chopped spinach almost creates a ground meat texture.
prepSteps: Cut sun-dried tomatoes in small strips
Take off top from beans and halve them

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat and add garlic
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, simmer until most of the moisture from the mushrooms is gone

cookSteps.title: Cook pasta and after ~2 minutes add green beans
cookSteps.detail: the beans need ~10 minutes so adjust based on the cooking time of pasta accordingly

cookSteps.title: Add tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes and pesto
cookSteps.detail: stir and bring to boil/simmer

cookSteps.title: Add spinach
cookSteps.detail: simmer until spinach is cooked in and everything is warm, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Fennel risotto
recipes.description: Geting risotto right isn't always easy but incredibly delicious. It doesn‚Äôt have to take long but requires your constant attention. Also: it‚Äôs worth buying high quality ingredients, especially for the stock and rice.
prepSteps: Pre-heat oven to 200¬∞C (if possible use fan oven at 175¬∞C)
Cut away the fennel stalks and cut like an onion into medium thick strips
Set the table (it's best to serve risotto immediately)

cookSteps.title: Spread fennel and zucchini on a baking sheet. Add salt and drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil
Boil water and mix bouillon
cookSteps.detail: keep it at a low boil

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat (in oil) until soft but not coloured

cookSteps.title: Add risotto rice and garlic
cookSteps.detail: stir so the rice becomes glassy but don't let it brown, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add white wine
cookSteps.detail: it should sizzle, cook until you don't see any liquid from the wine

cookSteps.title: Start adding hot bouillon, one bit at a time
cookSteps.detail: stir until nearly all has been absorbed - the rice should always be soft rather than dry. Repeat this process until the risotto is soft but still has a little bite (so it's important to taste it regularly). Add salt and pepper if needed. Keep stirring often. Adjust the heat if it's too hot, you have to avoid burning the risotto.

cookSteps.title: When the risotto is almost done, turn off the heat and add peas, freshly grated parmesan and margarine and stir rigorously
Mix in the roasted fennel and zucchini or serve it on top of the risotto
cookSteps.detail: A perfect risotto is creamy and much more fluid than rice (that's why risotto is served on a deep plate)

recipes.title: Pineapple curry
recipes.description: Despite Pablo‚Äôs pineapple story in the Fork Ranger book I have decided to add this recipe. I think many people will want to keep eating pineapples, so we better learn to buy them fairtrade. You could also replace pineapple with a sour apple like Granny Smith.
recipes.variationBody: In winter, fresh sugar snaps and green beans are often transported by air. So from September until April, it‚Äôs better to buy them frozen.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and carrots
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add bell pepper, sugar snaps, garlic and ginger
Cook rice with sunflower seeds
cookSteps.detail: add sunflower seeds at the beginning

cookSteps.title: Add coconut milk
cookSteps.detail: bring to boil and simmer

cookSteps.title: Add pineapple and cashews
cookSteps.detail: simmer

recipes.title: Moroccan Soup
recipes.description: This is a simpler version of a classic Moroccan dish and a great option for eating low carb for a night. Simmering the sauce for some time creates a deep flavour.
prepSteps: Cut bell pepper into short strips

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and carrots
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat, add ginger and garlic
Add cumin, cinnamon and paprika powder
Add bell pepper, canned tomatoes and bouillon
cookSteps.detail: simmer

cookSteps.title: Add chickpeas, lentils and some lemon juice to taste
cookSteps.detail: simmer

recipes.title: Orange prune rice
recipes.description: Orange juice with cinnamon is a wonderful combination, especially with the prunes. It sounds sweet but it‚Äôs more savoury than you might expect. You can serve it with a salad or other veggies; I used broccoli.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and carrots
cookSteps.detail: On medium/high heat

cookSteps.title: Add orange juice with bouillon
cookSteps.detail: Mix orange juice with bouillon so that you have 1,5 times the amount of rice. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to simmer and cover with a lid. Taste regularly and add more salt, pepper or bouillon if necessary

recipes.title: Caribbean Chilli
recipes.description: ‚ÄòCaribbean Jerk‚Äô is a seasoning mix from Jamaica with interesting combinations. Together with celery, lime and mango it creates a dish full of flavour. Confession: it takes a bit of effort to make it look as pretty as on the picture :-)
prepSteps: Cut bell peppers into small cubes
Either peel the outer layer of the celery and slice finely, or cook in boiling water for a few minutes. Otherwise the celery will be too hard.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and celery
cookSteps.detail: medium heat

cookSteps.title: Add garlic, all spices and bell pepper
cookSteps.detail: stir well, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add lime juice, kidney beans and coconut milk
cookSteps.detail: mix well and simmer, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

cookSteps.title: Add mango
cookSteps.detail: simmer a few minutes until warm

recipes.title: Balsamic Ravioli
recipes.description: This is the recipe for when you need something easy and fast, without compromising on taste.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, simmer until most of the moisture from the mushrooms is gone, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Cook ravioli
cookSteps.detail: see package

cookSteps.title: Add thyme, balsamic vinegar and 2 TBL sp of the water from cooking ravioli
Add spinach and peas
cookSteps.detail: simmer until spinach is thawed/cooked in, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Crunchy Noodles
recipes.description: The peanuts and mung bean sprouts give this noodle soup a crunchy bite. The soy sauce and stock create a nice salty flavour, so be careful with extra seasoning.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: high heat

cookSteps.title: Add ginger and carrots
cookSteps.detail: reduce heat and simmer until moisture of the mushrooms is gone

cookSteps.title: Add soy sauce, vinegar and about 100 ml from the stock in which the noodles cook
cookSteps.detail: stir and bring to boil/simmer

cookSteps.title: Add peanuts, mung bean sprouts, spring onions
cookSteps.detail: mix together

recipes.title: Minty Aubergine Wraps
recipes.description: The first time I grilled aubergines in a sandwich maker, my dad walked into the kitchen and asked whether I was cooking meat, that‚Äôs how great it smelled.

cookSteps.title: Grill aubergine
cookSteps.detail:
Option 1: cut aubergines into four thick slices and grill in a sandwich maker. Then cut into strips.
Option 2: cut aubergines into strips or cubes, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and grill in oven or frying pan

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat

cookSteps.title: Add tomatoes, corn and black beans
cookSteps.detail: stir and simmer, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Serve the wraps with hummus and mint, the grilled aubergine and the sauce

recipes.title: Banana curry
recipes.description: On the shores of Sri Lanka, I walked into a tiny restaurant with eight seats. I was the first. There was a buffet to serve yourself, and one of the meals was banana curry. It remains one of the best meals I‚Äôve ever had and this is my version that almost comes close to the original.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© bananas with 1 tea sp cinnamon
cookSteps.detail: on medium heat in plenty of oil, until outside is a bit crispy. Watch out, they burn quickly. Put aside.

cookSteps.title: Heat up new oil in the same pan and saut√© onions, ginger, garlic and aubergine
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, season with salt and pepper. Scrape sticky bits of banana from bottom of pan into the mix. Wait until aubergine is golden brown

cookSteps.title: Add curry and cinnamon
cookSteps.detail: stir and mix

cookSteps.title: Add coconut milk and lemon juice
cookSteps.detail: bring to boil and simmer

cookSteps.title: Add cashews and bananas
cookSteps.detail: taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Smokey Chilli
recipes.description: In the late 1800s, the chilli queens of San Antonio created chilli con carne. They entertained the plaza and supported their families in a time when women weren't supposed to. Hopefully this recipe can inspire you to also do something that isn't supposed to be: a delicious chilli sin carne. Don‚Äôt worry about the coffee, you won‚Äôt taste it at the end, but it is an essential ingredient to get the ‚Äòsmokey‚Äô taste.
prepSteps: Cut the spring onions in rings

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions
cookSteps.detail: medium heat

cookSteps.title: Add chilli, cinnamon, paprika powder, cumin and garlic
cookSteps.detail: toast the spices but don't let it burn

cookSteps.title: Add tomatoes, and coffee
cookSteps.detail: simmer, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add black beans
cookSteps.detail: simmer with lid on, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

cookSteps.title: Serve with bread and spring onions

recipes.title: Spaghetti Bolognese
recipes.description: The Bolognese sauce most people know is far removed from the original recipe, which is a very rich sauce. With this version I try to refer back to the original while also doing something completely different. If you want to make it vegetarian, simply skip the pancetta and start by saut√©ing the onion.
prepSteps: Cut celery and carrots into small pieces

cookSteps.title: Fry pancetta
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat until golden crispy

cookSteps.title: Saut√© mushrooms
cookSteps.detail:
start with high heat and then lower the heat until all moisture
is gone

cookSteps.title: Add thyme, onion, garlic, celery and carrots
cookSteps.detail: season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add red wine
cookSteps.detail: scrape sticky parts from bottom of the pan into the sauce

cookSteps.title: Add tomatoes, sugar and oregano
cookSteps.detail: bring to boil/simmer

cookSteps.title: Add tomato paste
cookSteps.detail: stir

cookSteps.title: Add bouillon

cookSteps.title: Add margarine
cookSteps.detail: stir

cookSteps.title: Add mushroom sauce
cookSteps.detail: simmer at least 15 min, preferably 1 hour

recipes.title: Brazilian Strogonof
recipes.description: This is a classic dish from Brazil that I turned into a meatless version. The unique flavour comes from using lots of mustard. The parmesan and crisps are also important. In Brazil they use a certain kind of crisps called 'batata palha'.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: high heat

cookSteps.title: Add garlic and zucchini
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, simmer until most of the moisture from the mushrooms is gone, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add tomatoes, mustard and coconut milk
cookSteps.detail: stir and bring to boil, lower heat and let simmer, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

cookSteps.title: Serve with parmesan and crumble the crisps on top

recipes.title: Brussels Sprouts with Apple
recipes.description: Not everyone likes brussels sprouts, but its bitter taste creates a delicious combination with the sweet apples, sour vinegar and umami from the cheese.
recipes.variationBody: The original recipe uses Gorgonzola which is more expensive and gives more flavour complexity to the dish

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion
cookSteps.detail: medium heat

cookSteps.title: Cook pasta, after 3 minutes add brussel sprouts
cookSteps.detail: cook for ~5 more minutes so pasta and sprouts are almost done

cookSteps.title: Add garlic, apples and spinach
cookSteps.detail: stir and let spinach cook in/thaw

cookSteps.title: Add (soy) cream and vinegar
cookSteps.detail: season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add everything into an oven dish and top with cheese and walnuts

recipes.title: Cauliflower Oven Pasta
recipes.description: This is a simple oven dish that is very flexible. You could variate with different kinds of vegetables, but I would keep in something with a bite like the sun-dried tomatoes.
prepSteps: Halve carrots and cut into slices
Cut sun-dried tomatoes into small strips

cookSteps.title: Cook pasta

cookSteps.title: Add pasta into an oven dish and mix with the sauce. ‚ÄòPlant‚Äô the cauliflower florets on top and sprinkle with cheese

recipes.title: Saffron Pasta
recipes.description: Saffron is the most expensive spice in the world, but luckily you only need very little. Simmering the sauce for a total of 25 minutes allows the taste to fully develop.
prepSteps: Cut bell pepper into thin strips

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion, garlic and ginger
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add saffron by rubbing the threads between your fingers before adding to the sauce

cookSteps.title: Add coconut milk, zucchini, and lemon zest

recipes.title: Mushroom Coconut Rice
recipes.description: A simple and rich rice that you can add your favourite vegetables to. The soy sauce and mushrooms create awesome umami flavours while the coconut milk creates silky smooth rice.
prepSteps: Rinse the rice under cold water

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat and add garlic and ginger
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, until mushrooms have shrunk

cookSteps.title: Add rice and soy sauce
cookSteps.detail: mix

cookSteps.title: Add coconut milk and bouillon

cookSteps.title: Add spinach
cookSteps.detail: mix

cookSteps.title: Serve with the dried baked onion strips

recipes.title: Indian curry
recipes.description: No country is better at eating vegetarian than India. What characterises Indian curries is heating up whole spices in oil. This is an essential part of curries and you can use this technique for any other curry in the book. Take some time for this one but don't be afraid, it's easier than it looks. The most important thing is tasting often and adding lots of spices.
prepSteps: Deseed and cut the chilli peppers
Cut the coriander leaves from the stems

cookSteps.title: Heat up plenty of oil with 5 cardamom pods, cinnamon and cumin seeds
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, stir to prevent burning

cookSteps.title: Add 1 TBL sp curry powder, onion and chilli pepper
cookSteps.detail: stir regularly until the onion turns golden brown

cookSteps.title: Add garlic and ginger
cookSteps.detail: add a splash of water if it almost burns, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add tomatoes
cookSteps.detail: taste and add salt and pepper if needed

cookSteps.title: Add cashews, coriander stems, turmeric and 1-2 tea sp curry powder
cookSteps.detail: at this point there should be a lot of flavour. Add more spices if necessary. Bring everything to a boil and simmer with the lid on

cookSteps.title: Spread cauliflower on a baking sheet and crumble feta on top
Cook rice
cookSteps.detail: Add 3 cardamom pods and salt

cookSteps.title: Puree into a smooth sauce
cookSteps.detail: This isn't crucial to the taste but makes it more appealing. If you don't puree, take out the cardamom pods at the end.

cookSteps.title: Add coconut milk and lime juice to taste
Serve with a slice of lime and coriander leaves

recipes.title: Spanish rice
recipes.description: A flavourful rice inspired by paella. Keep enough stock on the side but don't add it all at once. Keep tasting if the rice is ready and add more stock if necessary.
prepSteps: Cut zucchini and bell pepper into cubes
Rinse the rice under cold water

cookSteps.title: Spread bell peppers, broccoli and zucchini on a baking sheet and crumble feta on top, sprinkle with olive oil, salt and pepper
Saut√© onions
cookSteps.detail: medium heat

cookSteps.title: Add garlic, chilli, cumin, paprika powder and rice
Add tomatoes, lemon juice, oregano and half of the bouillon
cookSteps.detail: mix well and bring to a boil. Then reduce heat to simmer and put on the lid. Let it cook with lid. Taste regularly and add more bouillon, salt and pepper if necessary

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Noodles
recipes.description: The winning combination is the peanut butter with soy sauce and ginger. Pakchoy has a nice bite if you add it at the end. You could also replace it with spinach leaves.
prepSteps: Cut the carrots into slices (at 45¬∞ angle)
Cut pakchoy: the stem into small pieces. The leaves can be bigger

recipes.title: Nasi Goreng
recipes.description:
This Indonesian fried rice has three important aspects to get it right:
1) The best results happen with cold and dry rice. You could use frozen rice leftovers.
2) Kecap Manis, a sweet indonesian soy sauce. If you can't buy it, use soy sauce and syrup.
3) Extra Indonesian toppings and side dishes like a peanut sauce or fried egg.
prepSteps: Deseed and cut the chilli pepper

cookSteps.title: If you don't have leftover rice, cook the rice and spread it out to cool down
Saut√© onion, leek and carrots
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add chilli pepper, ginger and garlic
Add cashews, coriander, cumin and turmeric
cookSteps.detail: stir and mix

cookSteps.title: Slowly stir in the rice and kecap manis
cookSteps.detail: fry until caramelised on high heat. This only works if the rice is cold

recipes.title: Creamy Gnocchi
recipes.description: Gnocchi are a mix between pasta and dumplings. You usually cook them in water but saut√©ing them avoids the usual stickiness! They are often made from potatoes and you can find them in the pasta section. They only need 5 minutes to cook.
prepSteps: Halve beans and take off top

cookSteps.title: Cook green beans
cookSteps.detail: shock in cold water when done to prevent overcooking. Add to the sauce at the end.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat and add bell pepper and garlic
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, until most of the moisture from the mushrooms is gone

cookSteps.title: Add cumin, paprika powder, oregano and thyme
Saut√© gnocchi
cookSteps.detail: with oil on medium/high heat

cookSteps.detail: simmer, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

cookSteps.title: Serve the gnocchi with the sauce and rocket

recipes.title: Chickpea Wat
recipes.description: This Ethiopian recipe is very simple, it just needs a bit of time for the flavour to fully develop. It's important to use plenty of spices and better add a bit of stock later than making it too watery at the beginning. If you don't like chickpeas you can replace them with peas.
prepSteps: Cut potatoes into cubes or ca. 2 cm
Take off top from beans and halve them

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions
cookSteps.detail: medium heat

cookSteps.title: Add potatoes and carrots
cookSteps.detail: cover with a lid, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add ginger, spices and tomato paste

cookSteps.title: Add bouillon
cookSteps.detail: bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer

cookSteps.title: Add chickpeas and beans
cookSteps.detail: simmer on low heat until vegetables are tender

recipes.title: Lazy Tortellini
recipes.description: As a teenager, the only thing I could make for dinner was tortellini with ready-made tomato sauce. This is a homage to that time, upgraded for more taste and healthy veggies.
prepSteps: Cut off the ends of the green beans and cut them in half

cookSteps.title: Cook tortellini, after ~5 min add green beans
cookSteps.detail: tortellini usually needs about 15 min and the beans 10 min

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat

cookSteps.title: Add leek
cookSteps.detail: stir, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add tomatoes, garlic and pesto
cookSteps.detail: stir and bring to boil, then simmer, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Caponata
recipes.description: This traditional starter from Sicily is adapted to be a full meal. The combination of tomatoes, celery and Balsamic vinegar create an Italian sweet and sour sauce.
prepSteps: Dry capers on a paper towel
Either peel the outer layer of the celery and slice finely, or cook in boiling water for a few minutes. Otherwise the celery will be too hard.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and aubergine
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Reduce heat and add celery and garlic

cookSteps.title: Add capers, vinegar, sugar and oregano

recipes.title: Oven Pesto Potatoes
recipes.description: A simple oven dish for the potato lovers, with the pesto giving ‚Äòa taste of summer‚Äô as one review described it.
prepSteps: Cut bell peppers into short strips

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, until mushrooms shrink and moisture is gone

cookSteps.title: Cook potato slices, after ~3 min add broccoli (or cook in separate pan)
cookSteps.detail: cook for ~5 more minutes so potatoes and broccoli are almost done

cookSteps.title: Add garlic, paprika powder, bell peppers, pesto and (soy) cream
cookSteps.detail: mix well and let everything simmer until warm, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

cookSteps.title: Add potatoes into an oven dish and add half the sauce. Add the broccoli on top with the rest of the sauce and sprinkle with cheese

recipes.title: Low impact BBQ
recipes.description: A BBQ without meat doesn‚Äôt have to be boring, but at first I didn‚Äôt know how to do it. I often prepared veggie skewers but that was always a lot of work. The trick is putting the entire vegetable on the grill.
prepSteps: Don‚Äôt fire up the BBQ too hot (around 150-200¬∞C, like an oven). If you can, leave some space on the sides without coal so you can move around veggies that are at risk of turning black.

cookSteps.title: Sweet potatoes
cookSteps.detail: Place a whole potato on the grill right at the beginning. They take about 40 minutes until you can cut them in half and eat them with a spoon. Drizzle with olive oil and cinnamon! It‚Äôs like a dessert.

cookSteps.title: Onions
cookSteps.detail: Put them on with skin and all. The skin will turn completely black and that's okay. When they're soft on the inside, you can squeeze them out of the peels and eat the whole thing. You won't believe how delicious this is.

cookSteps.title: Aubergine with creme fraiche
cookSteps.detail: Place the entire aubergine on the grill, or directly on the charcoal, for about 10-15 minutes until it's very soft. If the skin turns black it's okay. Then cut it in half and with a spoon, scoop out the 'flesh'. Serve with a sauce made of creme fraiche, salt and pepper, and plenty of lemon juice.

cookSteps.title: Portobello
cookSteps.detail: Put the whole mushroom on the grill.

cookSteps.title: Corn cobs
cookSteps.detail: Turn regularly for about 10 minutes. Then spread some marinade on them: olive oil, cumin, paprika powder, salt, oregano.

cookSteps.title: Bell pepper with goat cheese
cookSteps.detail: Cut a bell pepper (preferably the pointed, long ones) in half, put a piece of goat cheese or feta inside and wrap in foil. They're ready when the bell pepper is soft and the cheese has melted.

recipes.credits:
Meat tip: Chicken drumsticks
This isn't vegetarian but it's the most sustainable meat option. Most people are used to eating chicken breast, but in India I learned that chicken thighs and legs have a lot more taste. That‚Äôs because those muscles are used more, especially if it‚Äôs organic chicken. This prevents the meat from drying out and makes the perfect BBQ meat.

Bonus tip: grill basket
If you're doing this more often I can highly recommend a grill basket. You can cut all kinds of veggies, throw in a bit of goat cheese and put the whole thing on the grill and it will be very delicious.

recipes.title: Garlic Lime Pasta
recipes.description: A fresh pasta recipe with an Asian touch! You could use less garlic if you want to but make sure to use plenty of lime juice. If you're not a fan of aubergine you could replace it with zucchini.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© aubergine
cookSteps.detail: high heat, take out aubergine and put aside

cookSteps.title: Saut√© peanuts, garlic and chilli flakes in plenty of oil

cookSteps.title: Cook broccoli
cookSteps.detail: drain under cold water afterwards

cookSteps.title: Add (soy) cream
cookSteps.detail: mix well

cookSteps.title: Add the aubergine, broccoli and pasta
cookSteps.detail: mix well

cookSteps.title: Add lime juice
cookSteps.detail: squeeze the lime and let everything simmer until warm, taste and add salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Creamy Pear Pasta
recipes.description: Pears and walnuts are a delicious combination. In this creamy pasta, this perfect couple comes into its own. Because of the mustard and enough pepper, there is also a bit of spice in it.

Cut off the ends of the green beans and cut them in half

cookSteps.title: Cook pasta and green beans

cookSteps.title: Mix the pasta and green beans with the sauce

recipes.title: Thai Peanut Curry
recipes.description: A rich and creamy curry inspired by the Thai 'Panang' curry. The soy sauce, peanut butter and coconut milk together with the spices give a great flavour to which you can add many different veggies. You could replace the spices with a Thai curry paste for convenience.
prepSteps: Cut carrots into long and thin strips
Cut bell pepper into long and thin stripes

cookSteps.title: Add bell pepper and broccoli

recipes.title: Sweet Potato and Lentil Curry
recipes.description: This one-pot curry is inspired by one of BBC Good Food's most popular recipes. By cooking the red lentils (don't use canned lentils) in the sauce it becomes a savoury stew with plenty of protein and fibre. You could also replace the spices with a Thai red curry paste.
prepSteps: Peel sweet potatoes and cut into 1 cm cubes

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion

cookSteps.title: Add ginger and garlic

recipes.title: Indonesian Spicy Cabbage
recipes.description: Inspired by the Indonesian Sajoer Bean dish, this recipe puts the not-so-common laos taste at the center of the dish. Overwhelmed by all the spices? Try looking for Sajoer Bean mix in the supermarket. It's also nice with tofu if you want to get a protein boost.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion, garlic and ginger
cookSteps.detail: medium heat

cookSteps.title: Add coconut milk and bouillon tablet

recipes.title: Tagliatelle with Pesto Rosso
recipes.description: This creamy pasta recipe uses 'pesto rosso', made from sun-dried tomatoes instead of basil. The almonds give a nice crunch and the rocket adds a bit of spiciness. You can play around with the amount of cream; if you want a lot of sauce you can add a bit more.

cookSteps.title: Remove the rosemary twigs and serve with the rocket salad and almonds

recipes.title: Vegetable Jambalaya
recipes.description: A light and flavourful vegetable version of a classic Creole dish that has its roots in the colonial mix of European, African and indigenous American traditions. The 'holy trinity' of Creole cuisine is celery, peppers, and onions. In this version it's really important to use smoked paprika powder and use plenty of it.
prepSteps: Cut bell peppers in small pieces
Drain canned lima beans and rinse

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onions, celery and bell pepper
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, until vegetables start to soften. Season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add smoked paprika powder, chilli flakes, thyme, garlic
Add bouillon, rice, canned tomatoes and lima beans
cookSteps.detail: keep stirring every now and then, add extra water if needed to prevent the rice from sticking to the pan

recipes.title: Nut Roast
recipes.description: Christmas special üéÑ Nut roast is a popular vegetarian Christmas dish in the UK, as an alternative to meat loaf or other roast dinners. Serve this savoury loaf with a soup and a salad and you have yourself a tasty Christmas dinner!
prepSteps: Put the nuts into a food processor or blender (or chop as finely as you can), keep apart
Put the onion, garlic, celery, carrots and mushrooms into a food processor or blender (or chop as finely as you can)

cookSteps.title: Saut√© the onion, garlic, celery, carrots, mushrooms, tomato paste and soy sauce
cookSteps.detail: until the veggies are softened on medium/high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Turn off heat, add nuts, breadcrumbs and fresh parsley
cookSteps.detail: mix well until it forms a thick paste, add a little water if it is too dry (it crumbles) and add some breadcrumbs if it is too wet

cookSteps.title: Line a loaf oven form with baking paper, and fill with the thick nut roast paste

recipes.title: Creamy Cabbage Potato Mash
recipes.description: The cabbage adds lots of vegetable and some nice crunch, while the brie gives it a rich, creamy texture. With the walnuts and sun-dried tomatoes it has some extra protein and bite. You can make the potato mash the conventional way with some butter and milk but we're using soy cream for a smooth and fluffy mash.
prepSteps: Peel potatoes and cut into pieces

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion
cookSteps.detail: medium heat, season with salt and pepper

Add cabbage mixture

recipes.title: Carrot Cauliflower Biryani
recipes.description: Biryani is the most ordered take-away dish in India. The flavourful rice is a wonderful combination with some fresh yoghurt and lime. In our simplified version we use cauliflower, which soaks up all the spices. It's important to use a pan with a lid so the cauliflower is steamed. This recipe is great for using the healthier brown rice.
prepSteps: Cut onion in rings and mince garlic

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion in the meantime
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat, season with salt and pepper

cookSteps.title: Add cauliflower and garlic

cookSteps.title: Add carrots and then put on lid
cookSteps.detail: medium heat and let it 'steam' with the lid on, check once in a while so the vegetables don't become too soft

cookSteps.title: Add peas, cashews and cooked rice
cookSteps.detail: mix and keep on high heat so the rice at the bottom becomes a little crispy

cookSteps.title: Serve with the yoghurt and coriander and squeeze some lime over the dish

recipes.title: Black Bean Fajitas
recipes.description: This classic tex-mex recipe is inspired by 'refried black beans', a traditional staple of the Mexican kitchen. Yes, it seems like a lot of beans but it forms into a paste and is just right for 8 big wraps. Two more tips: don't be afraid to use lots of coriander in the Guacamole and when in doubt, add more lime juice!
prepSteps: Cut red bell peppers into short strips

cookSteps.title: Saut√© onion

cookSteps.title: Add bell pepper, garlic, cumin, smoked paprika powder and chilli flakes
cookSteps.detail: medium/high heat

cookSteps.title: Add black beans (including the liquid of the can) and half of the tomatoes
cookSteps.detail: season with salt and pepper, bring to a boil and keep at medium heat so that water keeps boiling off and a paste is formed. With the back of a spoon, crush half of the beans

cookSteps.title: Make Guacamole: add avocados and remaining tomatoes in a bowl
cookSteps.detail: mash with a fork until it has the right structure, season with salt and pepper, and squeeze lime

cookSteps.title: Spread creme fraiche (or oat fraiche) over the wraps, add black bean mix, guacamole and fresh coriander
cookSteps.detail: Don't forget to add more lime juice

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Mash with Sauerkraut
recipes.description: The vegetables do all the work in this recipe and combine lots of different flavours. The sweetness of the apple balances the sauerkraut and the mushrooms add a nice umami taste. Even someone who usually doesn't like sauerkraut liked it. The portions are quite big because sauerkraut comes in packs of 500 g.

recipes.title: Easy Pesto Lasagne
recipes.description: The nice thing about this lasagne is that it's completely different than the traditional one. And it's also super easy. We tested it with mascarpone and oat spread and to our surprise, we liked the oat one better!

cookSteps.title: Heat mascarpone (or oat spread), bouillon and pesto

cookSteps.title: Add spinach and peas
cookSteps.detail: until the spinach has wilted and the peas thawed

cookSteps.title: Make the lasagne: sauce, tomatoes, parmesan, lasagna sheet, repeat
cookSteps.detail:
spread a thin layer of sauce in the oven form, add some parmesan, add lasagne sheets and repeat until a few layers have been formed. Finish with sauce, tomatoes and parmesan.

at 200¬∞C

recipes.title: Fennel Orange Couscous
recipes.description: In the oven, the fennel caramelises into delicious soft strips with only a hint of its liquorice flavour. The hazelnuts become extra crunchy and together with the fresh oranges it's a light and satisfying mix of flavours. This simple recipe could also be served as a salad.
prepSteps: Cut away the fennel stalks and the root and cut like an onion into medium thick strips

cookSteps.title: Spread fennel and zucchini on a baking sheet, add feta cubes and hazelnuts on top
cookSteps.detail: add salt and pepper and drizzle with plenty of olive oil

cookSteps.title: Cook pearl couscous in bouillon
cookSteps.detail: follow the instructions of the couscous

cookSteps.title: Cut oranges in 1-2 cm cubes and cut the mint leaves
Mix all ingredients before serving and add some salt and pepper if needed

recipes.title: Aubergine and Mushroom Pasta
recipes.description: This rich and savoury pasta sauce gets better with some extra time. So if you're not in a hurry, first finish the sauce and let it simmer, and then make the pasta. You could also save time by using two frying pans to saut√© the aubergines and mushrooms separately.

cookSteps.title: Saut√© shallots, garlic and mushrooms
cookSteps.detail: high heat, don't stirr too often so the mushrooms get browned, put aside when ready

cookSteps.title: Heat up new oil in the same pan and saut√© aubergine

cookSteps.title: Add red wine
cookSteps.detail: let it simmer until most of the wine is gone

cookSteps.title: Serve the aubergine ragout on top of the rigatoni, garnish with basil and some Parmesan

recipes.title: Sweet Chilli
recipes.description: This chilli with sweet potato and peaches is a delicious variation on the classic recipe. The peaches might be a bit unusual but it's a great combination with the spices and rich tomato flavour.

cookSteps.title: Garnish with fresh coriander and spring onions
